bastards,--as, I think, I have brought up some eleven--

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Ay, to eleven; and brought them down again. But
shall I search the market?

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: What else, man? The stuff we have, a strong wind
will blow it to pieces, they are so pitifully sodden.

linegroup.speaker: Pandar
linegroup.line: Thou sayest true; they're too unwholesome, o'
conscience. The poor Transylvanian is dead, that
lay with the little baggage.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Ay, she quickly pooped him; she made him roast-meat
for worms. But I'll go search the market.

linegroup.speaker: Pandar
linegroup.line: Three or four thousand chequins were as pretty a
proportion to live quietly, and so give over.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Why to give over, I pray you? is it a shame to get
when we are old?

linegroup.speaker: Pandar
linegroup.line: O, our credit comes not in like the commodity, nor
the commodity wages not with the danger: therefore,
if in our youths we could pick up some pretty
estate, 'twere not amiss to keep our door hatched.
Besides, the sore terms we stand upon with the gods
will be strong with us for giving over.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Come, other sorts offend as well as we.

linegroup.speaker: Pandar
linegroup.line: As well as we! ay, and better too; we offend worse.
Neither is our profession any trade; it's no
calling. But here comes Boult.

section.para: Re-enter BOULT, with the Pirates and MARINA

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: To MARINA Come your ways. My masters, you say
she's a virgin?

linegroup.speaker: First Pirate
linegroup.line: O, sir, we doubt it not.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Master, I have gone through for this piece, you see:
if you like her, so; if not, I have lost my earnest.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Boult, has she any qualities?

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: She has a good face, speaks well, and has excellent
good clothes: there's no further necessity of
qualities can make her be refused.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: What's her price, Boult?

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: I cannot be bated one doit of a thousand pieces.

linegroup.speaker: Pandar
linegroup.line: Well, follow me, my masters, you shall have your
money presently. Wife, take her in; instruct her
what she has to do, that she may not be raw in her
entertainment.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Boult, take you the marks of her, the colour of her
hair, complexion, height, age, with warrant of her
virginity; and cry 'He that will give most shall
have her first.' Such a maidenhead were no cheap
thing, if men were as they have been. Get this done
as I command you.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Performance shall follow.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Alack that Leonine was so slack, so slow!
He should have struck, not spoke; or that these pirates,
Not enough barbarous, had not o'erboard thrown me
For to seek my mother!

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Why lament you, pretty one?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: That I am pretty.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Come, the gods have done their part in you.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: I accuse them not.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: You are light into my hands, where you are like to live.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: The more my fault
To scape his hands where I was like to die.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Ay, and you shall live in pleasure.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: No.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Yes, indeed shall you, and taste gentlemen of all
fashions: you shall fare well; you shall have the
difference of all complexions. What! do you stop your ears?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Are you a woman?

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: What would you have me be, an I be not a woman?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: An honest woman, or not a woman.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Marry, whip thee, gosling: I think I shall have
something to do with you. Come, you're a young
foolish sapling, and must be bowed as I would have
you.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: The gods defend me!

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: If it please the gods to defend you by men, then men
must comfort you, men must feed you, men must stir
you up. Boult's returned.
Now, sir, hast thou cried her through the market?

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: I have cried her almost to the number of her hairs;
I have drawn her picture with my voice.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: And I prithee tell me, how dost thou find the
inclination of the people, especially of the younger sort?

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: 'Faith, they listened to me as they would have
hearkened to their father's testament. There was a
Spaniard's mouth so watered, that he went to bed to
her very description.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: We shall have him here to-morrow with his best ruff on.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: To-night, to-night. But, mistress, do you know the
French knight that cowers i' the hams?

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Who, Monsieur Veroles?

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Ay, he: he offered to cut a caper at the
proclamation; but he made a groan at it, and swore
he would see her to-morrow.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Well, well; as for him, he brought his disease
hither: here he does but repair it. I know he will
come in our shadow, to scatter his crowns in the
sun.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Well, if we had of every nation a traveller, we
should lodge them with this sign.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: To MARINA Pray you, come hither awhile. You
have fortunes coming upon you. Mark me: you must
seem to do that fearfully which you commit
willingly, despise profit where you have most gain.
To weep that you live as ye do makes pity in your
lovers: seldom but that pity begets you a good
opinion, and that opinion a mere profit.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: I understand you not.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: O, take her home, mistress, take her home: these
blushes of hers must be quenched with some present practise.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Thou sayest true, i' faith, so they must; for your
bride goes to that with shame which is her way to go
with warrant.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: 'Faith, some do, and some do not. But, mistress, if
I have bargained for the joint,--

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Thou mayst cut a morsel off the spit.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: I may so.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Who should deny it? Come, young one, I like the
manner of your garments well.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Ay, by my faith, they shall not be changed yet.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Boult, spend thou that in the town: report what a
sojourner we have; you'll lose nothing by custom.
When nature flamed this piece, she meant thee a good
turn; therefore say what a paragon she is, and thou
hast the harvest out of thine own report.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: I warrant you, mistress, thunder shall not so awake
the beds of eels as my giving out her beauty stir up
the lewdly-inclined. I'll bring home some to-night.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Come your ways; follow me.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: If fires be hot, knives sharp, or waters deep,
Untied I still my virgin knot will keep.
Diana, aid my purpose!

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: What have we to do with Diana? Pray you, will you go with us?

section.title: SCENE III. Tarsus. A room in CLEON's house.

linegroup.speaker: DIONYZA
linegroup.line: Why, are you foolish? Can it be undone?

linegroup.speaker: CLEON
linegroup.line: O Dionyza, such a piece of slaughter
The sun and moon ne'er look'd upon!

linegroup.speaker: DIONYZA
linegroup.line: I think
You'll turn a child again.

linegroup.speaker: CLEON
linegroup.line: Were I chief lord of all this spacious world,
I'ld give it to undo the deed. O lady,
Much less in blood than virtue, yet a princess
To equal any single crown o' the earth
I' the justice of compare! O villain Leonine!
Whom thou hast poison'd too:
If thou hadst drunk to him, 't had been a kindness
Becoming well thy fact: what canst thou say
When noble Pericles shall demand his child?

linegroup.speaker: DIONYZA
linegroup.line: That she is dead. Nurses are not the fates,
To foster it, nor ever to preserve.
She died at night; I'll say so. Who can cross it?
Unless you play the pious innocent,
And for an honest attribute cry out
'She died by foul play.'

linegroup.speaker: CLEON
linegroup.line: O, go to. Well, well,
Of all the faults beneath the heavens, the gods
Do like this worst.

linegroup.speaker: DIONYZA
linegroup.line: Be one of those that think
The petty wrens of Tarsus will fly hence,
And open this to Pericles. I do shame
To think of what a noble strain you are,
And of how coward a spirit.

linegroup.speaker: CLEON
linegroup.line: To such proceeding
Who ever but his approbation added,
Though not his prime consent, he did not flow
From honourable sources.

linegroup.speaker: DIONYZA
linegroup.line: Be it so, then:
Yet none does know, but you, how she came dead,
Nor none can know, Leonine being gone.
She did disdain my child, and stood between
Her and her fortunes: none would look on her,
But cast their gazes on Marina's face;
Whilst ours was blurted at and held a malkin
Not worth the time of day. It pierced me through;
And though you call my course unnatural,
You not your child well loving, yet I find
It greets me as an enterprise of kindness
Perform'd to your sole daughter.

linegroup.speaker: CLEON
linegroup.line: Heavens forgive it!

linegroup.speaker: DIONYZA
linegroup.line: And as for Pericles,
What should he say? We wept after her hearse,
And yet we mourn: her monument
Is almost finish'd, and her epitaphs
In glittering golden characters express
A general praise to her, and care in us
At whose expense 'tis done.

linegroup.speaker: CLEON
linegroup.line: Thou art like the harpy,
Which, to betray, dost, with thine angel's face,
Seize with thine eagle's talons.

linegroup.speaker: DIONYZA
linegroup.line: You are like one that superstitiously
Doth swear to the gods that winter kills the flies:
But yet I know you'll do as I advise.

section.title: SCENE IV
section.para: Enter GOWER, before the monument of MARINA at Tarsus

linegroup.speaker: GOWER
linegroup.line: Thus time we waste, and longest leagues make short;
Sail seas in cockles, have an wish but for't;
Making, to take your imagination,
From bourn to bourn, region to region.
By you being pardon'd, we commit no crime
To use one language in each several clime
Where our scenes seem to live. I do beseech you
To learn of me, who stand i' the gaps to teach you,
The stages of our story. Pericles
Is now again thwarting the wayward seas,
Attended on by many a lord and knight.
To see his daughter, all his life's delight.
Old Escanes, whom Helicanus late
Advanced in time to great and high estate,
Is left to govern. Bear you it in mind,
Old Helicanus goes along behind.
Well-sailing ships and bounteous winds have brought
This king to Tarsus,--think his pilot thought;
So with his steerage shall your thoughts grow on,--
To fetch his daughter home, who first is gone.
Like motes and shadows see them move awhile;
Your ears unto your eyes I'll reconcile.
linegroup.para: Enter PERICLES, at one door, with all his train; CLEON and DIONYZA, at the other. CLEON shows PERICLES the tomb; whereat PERICLES makes lamentation, puts on sackcloth, and in a mighty passion departs. Then exeunt CLEON and DIONYZA
linegroup.line: See how belief may suffer by foul show!
This borrow'd passion stands for true old woe;
And Pericles, in sorrow all devour'd,
With sighs shot through, and biggest tears
o'ershower'd,
Leaves Tarsus and again embarks. He swears
Never to wash his face, nor cut his hairs:
He puts on sackcloth, and to sea. He bears
A tempest, which his mortal vessel tears,
And yet he rides it out. Now please you wit.
The epitaph is for Marina writ
By wicked Dionyza.
linegroup.para: Reads the inscription on MARINA's monument
linegroup.line: 'The fairest, sweet'st, and best lies here,
Who wither'd in her spring of year.
She was of Tyrus the king's daughter,
On whom foul death hath made this slaughter;
Marina was she call'd; and at her birth,
Thetis, being proud, swallow'd some part o' the earth:
Therefore the earth, fearing to be o'erflow'd,
Hath Thetis' birth-child on the heavens bestow'd:
Wherefore she does, and swears she'll never stint,
Make raging battery upon shores of flint.'
No visor does become black villany
So well as soft and tender flattery.
Let Pericles believe his daughter's dead,
And bear his courses to be ordered
By Lady Fortune; while our scene must play
His daughter's woe and heavy well-a-day
In her unholy service. Patience, then,
And think you now are all in Mytilene.

section.title: SCENE V. Mytilene. A street before the brothel.
section.para: Enter, from the brothel, two Gentlemen

linegroup.speaker: First Gentleman
linegroup.line: Did you ever hear the like?

linegroup.speaker: Second Gentleman
linegroup.line: No, nor never shall do in such a place as this, she
being once gone.

linegroup.speaker: First Gentleman
linegroup.line: But to have divinity preached there! did you ever
dream of such a thing?

linegroup.speaker: Second Gentleman
linegroup.line: No, no. Come, I am for no more bawdy-houses:
shall's go hear the vestals sing?

linegroup.speaker: First Gentleman
linegroup.line: I'll do any thing now that is virtuous; but I
am out of the road of rutting for ever.

section.title: SCENE VI. The same. A room in the brothel.

linegroup.speaker: Pandar
linegroup.line: Well, I had rather than twice the worth of her she
had ne'er come here.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Fie, fie upon her! she's able to freeze the god
Priapus, and undo a whole generation. We must
either get her ravished, or be rid of her. When she
should do for clients her fitment, and do me the
kindness of our profession, she has me her quirks,
her reasons, her master reasons, her prayers, her
knees; that she would make a puritan of the devil,
if he should cheapen a kiss of her.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: 'Faith, I must ravish her, or she'll disfurnish us
of all our cavaliers, and make our swearers priests.

linegroup.speaker: Pandar
linegroup.line: Now, the pox upon her green-sickness for me!

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: 'Faith, there's no way to be rid on't but by the
way to the pox. Here comes the Lord Lysimachus disguised.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: We should have both lord and lown, if the peevish
baggage would but give way to customers.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: How now! How a dozen of virginities?

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Now, the gods to-bless your honour!

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: I am glad to see your honour in good health.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: You may so; 'tis the better for you that your
resorters stand upon sound legs. How now!
wholesome iniquity have you that a man may deal
withal, and defy the surgeon?

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: We have here one, sir, if she would--but there never
came her like in Mytilene.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: If she'ld do the deed of darkness, thou wouldst say.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Your honour knows what 'tis to say well enough.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Well, call forth, call forth.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: For flesh and blood, sir, white and red, you shall
see a rose; and she were a rose indeed, if she had but--

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: What, prithee?

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: O, sir, I can be modest.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: That dignifies the renown of a bawd, no less than it
gives a good report to a number to be chaste.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Here comes that which grows to the stalk; never
plucked yet, I can assure you.
Is she not a fair creature?

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: 'Faith, she would serve after a long voyage at sea.
Well, there's for you: leave us.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: I beseech your honour, give me leave: a word, and
I'll have done presently.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: I beseech you, do.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: To MARINA First, I would have you note, this is
an honourable man.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: I desire to find him so, that I may worthily note him.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Next, he's the governor of this country, and a man
whom I am bound to.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: If he govern the country, you are bound to him
indeed; but how honourable he is in that, I know not.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Pray you, without any more virginal fencing, will
you use him kindly? He will line your apron with gold.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: What he will do graciously, I will thankfully receive.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Ha' you done?

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: My lord, she's not paced yet: you must take some
pains to work her to your manage. Come, we will
leave his honour and her together. Go thy ways.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Now, pretty one, how long have you been at this trade?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: What trade, sir?

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Why, I cannot name't but I shall offend.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: I cannot be offended with my trade. Please you to name it.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: How long have you been of this profession?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: E'er since I can remember.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Did you go to 't so young? Were you a gamester at
five or at seven?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Earlier too, sir, if now I be one.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Why, the house you dwell in proclaims you to be a
creature of sale.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Do you know this house to be a place of such resort,
and will come into 't? I hear say you are of
honourable parts, and are the governor of this place.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Why, hath your principal made known unto you who I am?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Who is my principal?

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Why, your herb-woman; she that sets seeds and roots
of shame and iniquity. O, you have heard something
of my power, and so stand aloof for more serious
wooing. But I protest to thee, pretty one, my
authority shall not see thee, or else look friendly
upon thee. Come, bring me to some private place:
come, come.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: If you were born to honour, show it now;
If put upon you, make the judgment good
That thought you worthy of it.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: How's this? how's this? Some more; be sage.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: For me,
That am a maid, though most ungentle fortune
Have placed me in this sty, where, since I came,
Diseases have been sold dearer than physic,
O, that the gods
Would set me free from this unhallow'd place,
Though they did change me to the meanest bird
That flies i' the purer air!

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: I did not think
Thou couldst have spoke so well; ne'er dream'd thou couldst.
Had I brought hither a corrupted mind,
Thy speech had alter'd it. Hold, here's gold for thee:
Persever in that clear way thou goest,
And the gods strengthen thee!

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: The good gods preserve you!

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: For me, be you thoughten
That I came with no ill intent; for to me
The very doors and windows savour vilely.
Fare thee well. Thou art a piece of virtue, and
I doubt not but thy training hath been noble.
Hold, here's more gold for thee.
A curse upon him, die he like a thief,
That robs thee of thy goodness! If thou dost
Hear from me, it shall be for thy good.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: I beseech your honour, one piece for me.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Avaunt, thou damned door-keeper!
Your house, but for this virgin that doth prop it,
Would sink and overwhelm you. Away!

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: How's this? We must take another course with you.
If your peevish chastity, which is not worth a
breakfast in the cheapest country under the cope,
shall undo a whole household, let me be gelded like
a spaniel. Come your ways.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Whither would you have me?

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: I must have your maidenhead taken off, or the common
hangman shall execute it. Come your ways. We'll
have no more gentlemen driven away. Come your ways, I say.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: How now! what's the matter?

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Worse and worse, mistress; she has here spoken holy
words to the Lord Lysimachus.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: O abominable!

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: She makes our profession as it were to stink afore
the face of the gods.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Marry, hang her up for ever!

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: The nobleman would have dealt with her like a
nobleman, and she sent him away as cold as a
snowball; saying his prayers too.

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: Boult, take her away; use her at thy pleasure:
crack the glass of her virginity, and make the rest malleable.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: An if she were a thornier piece of ground than she
is, she shall be ploughed.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Hark, hark, you gods!

linegroup.speaker: Bawd
linegroup.line: She conjures: away with her! Would she had never
come within my doors! Marry, hang you! She's born
to undo us. Will you not go the way of women-kind?
Marry, come up, my dish of chastity with rosemary and bays!

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Come, mistress; come your ways with me.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Whither wilt thou have me?

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: To take from you the jewel you hold so dear.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Prithee, tell me one thing first.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Come now, your one thing.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: What canst thou wish thine enemy to be?

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Why, I could wish him to be my master, or rather, my mistress.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Neither of these are so bad as thou art,
Since they do better thee in their command.
Thou hold'st a place, for which the pained'st fiend
Of hell would not in reputation change:
Thou art the damned doorkeeper to every
Coistrel that comes inquiring for his Tib;
To the choleric fisting of every rogue
Thy ear is liable; thy food is such
As hath been belch'd on by infected lungs.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: What would you have me do? go to the wars, would
you? where a man may serve seven years for the loss
of a leg, and have not money enough in the end to
buy him a wooden one?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Do any thing but this thou doest. Empty
Old receptacles, or common shores, of filth;
Serve by indenture to the common hangman:
Any of these ways are yet better than this;
For what thou professest, a baboon, could he speak,
Would own a name too dear. O, that the gods
Would safely deliver me from this place!
Here, here's gold for thee.
If that thy master would gain by thee,
Proclaim that I can sing, weave, sew, and dance,
With other virtues, which I'll keep from boast:
And I will undertake all these to teach.
I doubt not but this populous city will
Yield many scholars.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: But can you teach all this you speak of?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Prove that I cannot, take me home again,
And prostitute me to the basest groom
That doth frequent your house.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: Well, I will see what I can do for thee: if I can
place thee, I will.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: But amongst honest women.

linegroup.speaker: BOULT
linegroup.line: 'Faith, my acquaintance lies little amongst them.
But since my master and mistress have bought you,
there's no going but by their consent: therefore I
will make them acquainted with your purpose, and I
doubt not but I shall find them tractable enough.
Come, I'll do for thee what I can; come your ways.

section.title: [Prologue]

linegroup.speaker: GOWER
linegroup.line: Marina thus the brothel 'scapes, and chances
Into an honest house, our story says.
She sings like one immortal, and she dances
As goddess-like to her admired lays;
Deep clerks she dumbs; and with her needle composes
Nature's own shape, of bud, bird, branch, or berry,
That even her art sisters the natural roses;
Her inkle, silk, twin with the rubied cherry:
That pupils lacks she none of noble race,
Who pour their bounty on her; and her gain
She gives the cursed bawd. Here we her place;
And to her father turn our thoughts again,
Where we left him, on the sea. We there him lost;
Whence, driven before the winds, he is arrived
Here where his daughter dwells; and on this coast
Suppose him now at anchor. The city strived
God Neptune's annual feast to keep: from whence
Lysimachus our Tyrian ship espies,
His banners sable, trimm'd with rich expense;
And to him in his barge with fervor hies.
In your supposing once more put your sight
Of heavy Pericles; think this his bark:
Where what is done in action, more, if might,
Shall be discover'd; please you, sit and hark.

section.title: SCENE I. On board PERICLES' ship, off Mytilene. A close pavilion on deck, with a curtain before it; PERICLES within it, reclined on a couch. A barge lying beside the Tyrian vessel.
section.para: Enter two Sailors, one belonging to the Tyrian vessel, the other to the barge; to them HELICANUS

linegroup.speaker: Tyrian Sailor
linegroup.line: To the Sailor of Mytilene Where is lord Helicanus?
he can resolve you.
O, here he is.
Sir, there's a barge put off from Mytilene,
And in it is Lysimachus the governor,
Who craves to come aboard. What is your will?

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: That he have his. Call up some gentlemen.

linegroup.speaker: Tyrian Sailor
linegroup.line: Ho, gentlemen! my lord calls.

linegroup.speaker: First Gentleman
linegroup.line: Doth your lordship call?

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: Gentlemen, there's some of worth would come aboard;
I pray ye, greet them fairly.

section.para: The Gentlemen and the two Sailors descend, and go on board the barge
Enter, from thence, LYSIMACHUS and Lords; with the Gentlemen and the two Sailors

linegroup.speaker: Tyrian Sailor
linegroup.line: Sir,
This is the man that can, in aught you would,
Resolve you.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Hail, reverend sir! the gods preserve you!

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: And you, sir, to outlive the age I am,
And die as I would do.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: You wish me well.
Being on shore, honouring of Neptune's triumphs,
Seeing this goodly vessel ride before us,
I made to it, to know of whence you are.

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: First, what is your place?

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: I am the governor of this place you lie before.

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: Sir,
Our vessel is of Tyre, in it the king;
A man who for this three months hath not spoken
To any one, nor taken sustenance
But to prorogue his grief.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Upon what ground is his distemperature?

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: 'Twould be too tedious to repeat;
But the main grief springs from the loss
Of a beloved daughter and a wife.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: May we not see him?

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: You may;
But bootless is your sight: he will not speak To any.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Yet let me obtain my wish.

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: Behold him.
This was a goodly person,
Till the disaster that, one mortal night,
Drove him to this.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Sir king, all hail! the gods preserve you!
Hail, royal sir!

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: It is in vain; he will not speak to you.

linegroup.speaker: First Lord
linegroup.line: Sir,
We have a maid in Mytilene, I durst wager,
Would win some words of him.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: 'Tis well bethought.
She questionless with her sweet harmony
And other chosen attractions, would allure,
And make a battery through his deafen'd parts,
Which now are midway stopp'd:
She is all happy as the fairest of all,
And, with her fellow maids is now upon
The leafy shelter that abuts against
The island's side.

section.para: Whispers a Lord, who goes off in the barge of LYSIMACHUS

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: Sure, all's effectless; yet nothing we'll omit
That bears recovery's name. But, since your kindness
We have stretch'd thus far, let us beseech you
That for our gold we may provision have,
Wherein we are not destitute for want,
But weary for the staleness.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: O, sir, a courtesy
Which if we should deny, the most just gods
For every graff would send a caterpillar,
And so afflict our province. Yet once more
Let me entreat to know at large the cause
Of your king's sorrow.

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: Sit, sir, I will recount it to you:
But, see, I am prevented.

section.para: Re-enter, from the barge, Lord, with MARINA, and a young Lady

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: O, here is
The lady that I sent for. Welcome, fair one!
Is't not a goodly presence?

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: She's a gallant lady.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: She's such a one, that, were I well assured
Came of a gentle kind and noble stock,
I'ld wish no better choice, and think me rarely wed.
Fair one, all goodness that consists in bounty
Expect even here, where is a kingly patient:
If that thy prosperous and artificial feat
Can draw him but to answer thee in aught,
Thy sacred physic shall receive such pay
As thy desires can wish.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Sir, I will use
My utmost skill in his recovery, Provided
That none but I and my companion maid
Be suffer'd to come near him.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Come, let us leave her;
And the gods make her prosperous!

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Mark'd he your music?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: No, nor look'd on us.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: See, she will speak to him.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Hail, sir! my lord, lend ear.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Hum, ha!

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: I am a maid,
My lord, that ne'er before invited eyes,
But have been gazed on like a comet: she speaks,
My lord, that, may be, hath endured a grief
Might equal yours, if both were justly weigh'd.
Though wayward fortune did malign my state,
My derivation was from ancestors
Who stood equivalent with mighty kings:
But time hath rooted out my parentage,
And to the world and awkward casualties
Bound me in servitude.
I will desist;
But there is something glows upon my cheek,
And whispers in mine ear, 'Go not till he speak.'

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: My fortunes--parentage--good parentage--
To equal mine!--was it not thus? what say you?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: I said, my lord, if you did know my parentage,
You would not do me violence.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: I do think so. Pray you, turn your eyes upon me.
You are like something that--What country-woman?
Here of these shores?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: No, nor of any shores:
Yet I was mortally brought forth, and am
No other than I appear.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: I am great with woe, and shall deliver weeping.
My dearest wife was like this maid, and such a one
My daughter might have been: my queen's square brows;
Her stature to an inch; as wand-like straight;
As silver-voiced; her eyes as jewel-like
And cased as richly; in pace another Juno;
Who starves the ears she feeds, and makes them hungry,
The more she gives them speech. Where do you live?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Where I am but a stranger: from the deck
You may discern the place.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Where were you bred?
And how achieved you these endowments, which
You make more rich to owe?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: If I should tell my history, it would seem
Like lies disdain'd in the reporting.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Prithee, speak:
Falseness cannot come from thee; for thou look'st
Modest as Justice, and thou seem'st a palace
For the crown'd Truth to dwell in: I will
believe thee,
And make my senses credit thy relation
To points that seem impossible; for thou look'st
Like one I loved indeed. What were thy friends?
Didst thou not say, when I did push thee back--
Which was when I perceived thee--that thou camest
From good descending?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: So indeed I did.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Report thy parentage. I think thou said'st
Thou hadst been toss'd from wrong to injury,
And that thou thought'st thy griefs might equal mine,
If both were open'd.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Some such thing
I said, and said no more but what my thoughts
Did warrant me was likely.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Tell thy story;
If thine consider'd prove the thousandth part
Of my endurance, thou art a man, and I
Have suffer'd like a girl: yet thou dost look
Like Patience gazing on kings' graves, and smiling
Extremity out of act. What were thy friends?
How lost thou them? Thy name, my most kind virgin?
Recount, I do beseech thee: come, sit by me.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: My name is Marina.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: O, I am mock'd,
And thou by some incensed god sent hither
To make the world to laugh at me.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Patience, good sir,
Or here I'll cease.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Nay, I'll be patient.
Thou little know'st how thou dost startle me,
To call thyself Marina.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: The name
Was given me by one that had some power,
My father, and a king.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: How! a king's daughter?
And call'd Marina?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: You said you would believe me;
But, not to be a troubler of your peace,
I will end here.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: But are you flesh and blood?
Have you a working pulse? and are no fairy?
Motion! Well; speak on. Where were you born?
And wherefore call'd Marina?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Call'd Marina
For I was born at sea.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: At sea! what mother?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: My mother was the daughter of a king;
Who died the minute I was born,
As my good nurse Lychorida hath oft
Deliver'd weeping.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: O, stop there a little!
This is the rarest dream that e'er dull sleep
Did mock sad fools withal: this cannot be:
My daughter's buried. Well: where were you bred?
I'll hear you more, to the bottom of your story,
And never interrupt you.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: You scorn: believe me, 'twere best I did give o'er.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: I will believe you by the syllable
Of what you shall deliver. Yet, give me leave:
How came you in these parts? where were you bred?

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: The king my father did in Tarsus leave me;
Till cruel Cleon, with his wicked wife,
Did seek to murder me: and having woo'd
A villain to attempt it, who having drawn to do't,
A crew of pirates came and rescued me;
Brought me to Mytilene. But, good sir,
Whither will you have me? Why do you weep?
It may be,
You think me an impostor: no, good faith;
I am the daughter to King Pericles,
If good King Pericles be.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Ho, Helicanus!

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: Calls my lord?

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Thou art a grave and noble counsellor,
Most wise in general: tell me, if thou canst,
What this maid is, or what is like to be,
That thus hath made me weep?

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: I know not; but
Here is the regent, sir, of Mytilene
Speaks nobly of her.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: She would never tell
Her parentage; being demanded that,
She would sit still and weep.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: O Helicanus, strike me, honour'd sir;
Give me a gash, put me to present pain;
Lest this great sea of joys rushing upon me
O'erbear the shores of my mortality,
And drown me with their sweetness. O, come hither,
Thou that beget'st him that did thee beget;
Thou that wast born at sea, buried at Tarsus,
And found at sea again! O Helicanus,
Down on thy knees, thank the holy gods as loud
As thunder threatens us: this is Marina.
What was thy mother's name? tell me but that,
For truth can never be confirm'd enough,
Though doubts did ever sleep.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: First, sir, I pray,
What is your title?

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: I am Pericles of Tyre: but tell me now
My drown'd queen's name, as in the rest you said
Thou hast been godlike perfect,
The heir of kingdoms and another like
To Pericles thy father.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: Is it no more to be your daughter than
To say my mother's name was Thaisa?
Thaisa was my mother, who did end
The minute I began.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Now, blessing on thee! rise; thou art my child.
Give me fresh garments. Mine own, Helicanus;
She is not dead at Tarsus, as she should have been,
By savage Cleon: she shall tell thee all;
When thou shalt kneel, and justify in knowledge
She is thy very princess. Who is this?

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: Sir, 'tis the governor of Mytilene,
Who, hearing of your melancholy state,
Did come to see you.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: I embrace you.
Give me my robes. I am wild in my beholding.
O heavens bless my girl! But, hark, what music?
Tell Helicanus, my Marina, tell him
O'er, point by point, for yet he seems to doubt,
How sure you are my daughter. But, what music?

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: My lord, I hear none.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: None!
The music of the spheres! List, my Marina.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: It is not good to cross him; give him way.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Rarest sounds! Do ye not hear?

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: My lord, I hear.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Most heavenly music!
It nips me unto listening, and thick slumber
Hangs upon mine eyes: let me rest.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: A pillow for his head:
So, leave him all. Well, my companion friends,
If this but answer to my just belief,
I'll well remember you.

section.para: DIANA appears to PERICLES as in a vision

linegroup.speaker: DIANA
linegroup.line: My temple stands in Ephesus: hie thee thither,
And do upon mine altar sacrifice.
There, when my maiden priests are met together,
Before the people all,
Reveal how thou at sea didst lose thy wife:
To mourn thy crosses, with thy daughter's, call
And give them repetition to the life.
Or perform my bidding, or thou livest in woe;
Do it, and happy; by my silver bow!
Awake, and tell thy dream.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Celestial Dian, goddess argentine,
I will obey thee. Helicanus!

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: Sir?

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: My purpose was for Tarsus, there to strike
The inhospitable Cleon; but I am
For other service first: toward Ephesus
Turn our blown sails; eftsoons I'll tell thee why.
Shall we refresh us, sir, upon your shore,
And give you gold for such provision
As our intents will need?

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Sir,
With all my heart; and, when you come ashore,
I have another suit.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: You shall prevail,
Were it to woo my daughter; for it seems
You have been noble towards her.

linegroup.speaker: LYSIMACHUS
linegroup.line: Sir, lend me your arm.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Come, my Marina.

section.title: SCENE II
section.para: Enter GOWER, before the temple of DIANA at Ephesus

linegroup.speaker: GOWER
linegroup.line: Now our sands are almost run;
More a little, and then dumb.
This, my last boon, give me,
For such kindness must relieve me,
That you aptly will suppose
What pageantry, what feats, what shows,
What minstrelsy, and pretty din,
The regent made in Mytilene
To greet the king. So he thrived,
That he is promised to be wived
To fair Marina; but in no wise
Till he had done his sacrifice,
As Dian bade: whereto being bound,
The interim, pray you, all confound.
In feather'd briefness sails are fill'd,
And wishes fall out as they're will'd.
At Ephesus, the temple see,
Our king and all his company.
That he can hither come so soon,
Is by your fancy's thankful doom.

section.title: SCENE III. The temple of Diana at Ephesus; THAISA standing near the altar, as high priestess; a number of Virgins on each side; CERIMON and other Inhabitants of Ephesus attending.
section.para: Enter PERICLES, with his train; LYSIMACHUS, HELICANUS, MARINA, and a Lady

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Hail, Dian! to perform thy just command,
I here confess myself the king of Tyre;
Who, frighted from my country, did wed
At Pentapolis the fair Thaisa.
At sea in childbed died she, but brought forth
A maid-child call'd Marina; who, O goddess,
Wears yet thy silver livery. She at Tarsus
Was nursed with Cleon; who at fourteen years
He sought to murder: but her better stars
Brought her to Mytilene; 'gainst whose shore
Riding, her fortunes brought the maid aboard us,
Where, by her own most clear remembrance, she
Made known herself my daughter.

linegroup.speaker: THAISA
linegroup.line: Voice and favour!
You are, you are--O royal Pericles!

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: What means the nun? she dies! help, gentlemen!

linegroup.speaker: CERIMON
linegroup.line: Noble sir,
If you have told Diana's altar true,
This is your wife.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Reverend appearer, no;
I threw her overboard with these very arms.

linegroup.speaker: CERIMON
linegroup.line: Upon this coast, I warrant you.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: 'Tis most certain.

linegroup.speaker: CERIMON
linegroup.line: Look to the lady; O, she's but o'erjoy'd.
Early in blustering morn this lady was
Thrown upon this shore. I oped the coffin,
Found there rich jewels; recover'd her, and placed her
Here in Diana's temple.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: May we see them?

linegroup.speaker: CERIMON
linegroup.line: Great sir, they shall be brought you to my house,
Whither I invite you. Look, Thaisa is recovered.

linegroup.speaker: THAISA
linegroup.line: O, let me look!
If he be none of mine, my sanctity
Will to my sense bend no licentious ear,
But curb it, spite of seeing. O, my lord,
Are you not Pericles? Like him you spake,
Like him you are: did you not name a tempest,
A birth, and death?

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: The voice of dead Thaisa!

linegroup.speaker: THAISA
linegroup.line: That Thaisa am I, supposed dead
And drown'd.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Immortal Dian!

linegroup.speaker: THAISA
linegroup.line: Now I know you better.
When we with tears parted Pentapolis,
The king my father gave you such a ring.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: This, this: no more, you gods! your present kindness
Makes my past miseries sports: you shall do well,
That on the touching of her lips I may
Melt and no more be seen. O, come, be buried
A second time within these arms.

linegroup.speaker: MARINA
linegroup.line: My heart
Leaps to be gone into my mother's bosom.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Look, who kneels here! Flesh of thy flesh, Thaisa;
Thy burden at the sea, and call'd Marina
For she was yielded there.

linegroup.speaker: THAISA
linegroup.line: Blest, and mine own!

linegroup.speaker: HELICANUS
linegroup.line: Hail, madam, and my queen!

linegroup.speaker: THAISA
linegroup.line: I know you not.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: You have heard me say, when I did fly from Tyre,
I left behind an ancient substitute:
Can you remember what I call'd the man?
I have named him oft.

linegroup.speaker: THAISA
linegroup.line: 'Twas Helicanus then.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Still confirmation:
Embrace him, dear Thaisa; this is he.
Now do I long to hear how you were found;
How possibly preserved; and who to thank,
Besides the gods, for this great miracle.

linegroup.speaker: THAISA
linegroup.line: Lord Cerimon, my lord; this man,
Through whom the gods have shown their power; that can
From first to last resolve you.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Reverend sir,
The gods can have no mortal officer
More like a god than you. Will you deliver
How this dead queen re-lives?

linegroup.speaker: CERIMON
linegroup.line: I will, my lord.
Beseech you, first go with me to my house,
Where shall be shown you all was found with her;
How she came placed here in the temple;
No needful thing omitted.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Pure Dian, bless thee for thy vision! I
Will offer night-oblations to thee. Thaisa,
This prince, the fair-betrothed of your daughter,
Shall marry her at Pentapolis. And now,
This ornament
Makes me look dismal will I clip to form;
And what this fourteen years no razor touch'd,
To grace thy marriage-day, I'll beautify.

linegroup.speaker: THAISA
linegroup.line: Lord Cerimon hath letters of good credit, sir,
My father's dead.

linegroup.speaker: PERICLES
linegroup.line: Heavens make a star of him! Yet there, my queen,
We'll celebrate their nuptials, and ourselves
Will in that kingdom spend our following days:
Our son and daughter shall in Tyrus reign.
Lord Cerimon, we do our longing stay
To hear the rest untold: sir, lead's the way.

linegroup.speaker: GOWER
linegroup.line: In Antiochus and his daughter you have heard
Of monstrous lust the due and just reward:
In Pericles, his queen and daughter, seen,
Although assail'd with fortune fierce and keen,
Virtue preserved from fell destruction's blast,
Led on by heaven, and crown'd with joy at last:
In Helicanus may you well descry
A figure of truth, of faith, of loyalty:
In reverend Cerimon there well appears
The worth that learned charity aye wears:
For wicked Cleon and his wife, when fame
Had spread their cursed deed, and honour'd name
Of Pericles, to rage the city turn,
That him and his they in his palace burn;
The gods for murder seemed so content
To punish them; although not done, but meant.
So, on your patience evermore attending,
New joy wait on you! Here our play has ending.
